#summary Coderush plugin designed to ease the process of moving from Resharper
[http://www.rorybecker.me.uk/DevExpress/Plugins/Community/CR_ReSharperCompatibility/ http://dxcorecommunityplugins.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Common/Graphics/Download.png]      [http://code.google.com/p/dxcorecommunityplugins/wiki/InstallInstructions  http://dxcorecommunityplugins.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Common/Graphics/InstallHelp.png]
= Introduction =

This is a simple plugin and a set of key bindings (currently 34 listed below) designed to ease the process of moving from Resharper or just testing out Coderush and RefactorPro from a Resharper user's point of view.

= Additional Install Help =

The shortcut ini files should be extracted to your Settings\IDE folder. You can find the Settings folder through the use of a button on the DevExpress 'About' dialog. Found on the DevExpress\About menu

= Support =
Several Resharper functions are now supported:

http://dxcorecommunityplugins.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/CR_ReSharperCompatibility/Screenshots/ResharperKeys1.png

http://dxcorecommunityplugins.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/CR_ReSharperCompatibility/Screenshots/ResharperKeys2.png

= Source = 
Coderush, like this plugin, is build on top of the [http://devexpress.com/dxcore DXCore] and the source to this plugin as with all [http://code.google.com/p/dxcorecommunityplugins others on this site] is available free to all.

We would also like to encourage others to fill in any gaps that are felt to be missing :)

This page will be improved over time, but should be enough to get you started.
